data.title: a taste of Spain in Hollywood
data.text: This small restaurant is a local regular for my husband and I. We usually go Friday nights.  It's a small place right on downtown Hollywood! They have a variety of Spanish tapas that are very inexpensive.They have a variety of Spanish wines and beers. They have a flamenco show with a singer and dancer which is pretty good and entertaining.

data.title: Good tapas place
data.text: Good tapas place with authentic feel and staff. Vino options and plates are reminiscent of Spain. Small place but well located.

data.title: Great ambience , food ,service
data.text:
Being there a dozen of times , great flamenco show Thursday Friday Saturday, servers are super nice and attentive , Spanish food try their tapas (typical appetizers) or paella .
Owner wife is a excellent chef.
For a romantic dinner or 15 persons party is the place. Small place need to reserve.

data.title: Good Spain atmosphere
data.text: The place is good, I enjoyed the Estopa's music and the place has a nice Spanish decoration. The food is good but don't turn on you crazy, It's just good. The banderillas are really small like 4 pieces of solomillo. The food is cooked well I ordered cazerola de pescado or cazerol of fish and baked potatoes, It was tasty.  The customer service was poor.

data.title: Simply The Best Spanish Restaurant in South Florida!!!
data.text:
This was love at first sight! The ambiance, the music, the decor, the people, the food,the service, the live performances, and best of it all : Mary, the owner! No other place in the Hollywood area made us feel like family and at home  like Buleria did. It was like going to your mom's house for dinner! During our 8 days stay in Hollywood, we ate here 3 times!
Mary, the owner is an amazing person! This place has only been open for a few years and reservations are recommended during dinner time because it gets very very packed!  And there is only seating for 40 people at one time, so call and make a reservation before you go there or you will have to wait a long time to be seated!
What Mary has accomplished here is amazing! Once you have entered the restaurant you feel like you are back in Spain. The decor alone is just Spanish beyond any doubt.
The staff is friendly and very attentive. The food is as authentic as the decor. Almost all the ingredients are imported from Spain.
Let's talk Tapas! We tried many different tapas: garbanzos and chorizo, blood sausage, chorizo in jerez, pulpo, croquetas, jamon iberico, cheeses, etc... Tapas alone will fill you up quick! But they were all sooooooo good!
Can we talk about Mary's amazing paellas? Yes! I tried two of them and I was in heaven!!! People...I am half Spanish and her paellas made me so happy that a tear or two were shed (or at least that's what I was told by those with me!). The first night I tried the regular seafood paella. I was not  disappointed at all. The woman knows how to make paella, No questions about it. During our last visit she made me her Paella Cantabrica (black paella). I have never seen or heard of black paella before but now it has become my favorite. If you visit Buleri and you like squid and octopus, this is the paella for you!
Let's talk about the amazing entertainment! Two of the time we visited the restaurant was showcasing amazing performers! A small stage is set up right by the entrance and flamenco dancers and guitarists perform there on selected nights and it is just out of this world!  The atmosphere is so festive that one can just jump on one's feet and join the festive music!  
On our last night there, Mary shared with us as a token of friendship a very expensive and delicious Spanish Jerez (Port/Sherry). We felt honored. 
There are not enough words to describe Mary's hospitality and warmth spirit. Her love and passion for her trade shows. Thesis by far the best place to visit while in Downtown Hollywood and we will be back soon!
Cheers, Mary! Many more years of success and happiness!
Joe & Wayne

data.title: Great Paella
data.text: My wife and I visited here for our last night in Hollywood, a Thursday early evening.  We decided on the paella with seafood, chicken and sausage (you can order for 2 or 4 people), and as it was going to be at least 25 minutes (on busy nights I guess it can be as long as 45 min.) we ordered the bacon-wrapped dates as an appetizer.  The dates were an unexpected delight of sweet and salty, and the paella was as good as I remember having in Barcelona many years ago.  We were also treated to some Spanish guitar and flamenco dancing, which was unexpected since the website said only Friday and Saturday entertainment.  A very enjoyable meal.  Recommended.

data.title: Great local spanish restaurant
data.text: Buleria Restaurant is a small local restaurant that has really good food,  Some nights they have live music and dance which is real fun.

data.title: Visited memorial Day
data.text: I have visited before with family and was a good experience. Went back with a friend had some appetizers and sangria before have the main dish a paella negra. The appetizers were great the sangria was not the best I have had. But was disappointed was the paella. For $38 you would think it would be full of seafood. It was mostly rice the flavor was good. It was a slow night at the place. The service was great. For a total bill of $87 for two I would say not a good value.

data.title: Amazing Spanish place
data.text: Ok, I am partial to Spanish food having spent time in Madrid and having run with the bulls in Pamplona when I was younger.  The tapas here is wonderful and the wine selection is great.  Get reservations for the flamenco on Friday and Saturday since the place will is very small and will be sold out.  Don't miss this show.  If you have never seen flamenco you will be dazzled by the passion of the dancers and music.  So get off the beach, take the 5 minute drive to downtown Hollywood, and get a taste of Spanish culture.

data.title: Fabulous Paella, Flamenco and Guitar
data.text:
This is Spain in a cozy storefront. We come here for special occasions or when ever in town. Mary and Alejandro will greet you like family. We always have the platter of Spanish cheeses, sausage and olives with a glass of Rioja or Albarino if you prefer white.
Enjoy the shrimp and garlic tapas , the tuna stuffed peppers or share the paella. It is all good.Wonderful Flamenco and Spanish guitar to entertain you. If you are celebrating you can join them on stage. Comfortable for families,gatherings, or a romantic dinner for two.

data.title: Great Show and great Paella
data.text: Make reservations as it's a small place but the guitarists and dancers were exceptional and the food was good too.

data.title: crowded
data.text: was crowded when we were there and we waited a little longer food, but the food was good, staff friendly

data.title: Unexpected Delight
data.text:
Limited Street appeal as location at west end of the strip only affords 3 patio tables in open. Numerous excellent ratings and awards on door however enticed us to try and glad we did. Had Sangria and a number of tapas for lunch. All were fresh, tasty and excellent value.
Interior much more comfortable and clean. Very Spanish. washrooms very clean.
Service was friendly, helpful and well timed.
Prices were reasonable.
Have to go back and try dinner when they have live entertainment.

Don't let the outside looks fool you. Far better than appearance from the street might suggest.

data.title: Great paella
data.text: Had been to this restaurant for tapas which were great decided to go back to try the paella what a terrific choice.  Four of us shared and it was delicious with nothing left, so tasty, we had the Valencia.  Before the entree we had a delicious salad and the best lentil soup.  All toasted with sangria.  We are going to try their music night next...our waiter couldn't have been any nicer, friendly and informative an extra reason to return which we will definitely do soon

data.title: Getting worst !!!!
data.text:
I been there more than 10 times in the last 2 years because the food is good and we live in the area, but this time is the LAST one, customer service is the WORST in South Florida.
So, we're going back to Lola's Gourmet for the Pulpo a la gallega, who is MUCH better and worth it the hour and fifteen minutes drive from home.

data.title: Ole,wonderful, rich, flavorful
data.text:
If you love Spanish food this is a definite-must try. My husband  and I go often and its wonderful every time. Located in downtown Hollywood, very nice atmosphere, beautiful craft-made bar, lots of Spanish décor and incredible food and service.
Some times we go just for tapas, I'll mention some, Spanish potato omelet, sautéed artichokes with Serrano ham, chickpeas with Spanish chorizo/sausage. We have also had some of their entrees, Cacerola de Perscado, fish cooked in Marinara sauce & white wine with Kalamata olives on a potato be., Grilled fish with vegetables and Paella. Eveything sooo tasty.
As for their Sangria, its rich and refreshing, we always get it.
Giancarlo our usual server is very attentive and provides outstanding service.
They also have a beautiful Flamenco show on weekends and I recommend you make reservations, because the place is not very big.
Enjoy and Ole

data.title: Fabulous
data.text: Everything is so tasty. Start with the sangria, don't forget the dates wrapped in bacon, octopus with potatoes, and meat and cheese plate. Then the Paellas is a must. Enjoy

data.title: Valentines Dinner
data.text: The website states that there is parking behind building,but on this particular evening it took us 2 attempts Had to drive back around and come back up Hollywood Blvd.Our table was ready when we arrived. The Sangria was very good ,the Garaffe was large. We sampled The Potato Ali Oli,  eggplant , cheese/meat platter which were all delicious . We were both satisfied. The Entertainment made our evening special.We didn't find the noise level high and we were seated up front by the stage.We will be back to sample some different Tapas. Our service was excellent

data.title: Tasty and Entertaining.
data.text: This small restaurant boasts great service and good food. Prices are reasonable. The house wines are good and the Flamenco dancing is delicious (why no castanets?) I shall return soon and I apologize for having no change to tip the dancer - I shall make up for it next time. One slight drawback (I must find one.) Why the need for amplifiers in such a small restaurant? I love to hear the guitar without amplification and the crack of the Flamenco shoe certainly needs none.

data.title: Extremely slow and bad customer service
data.text: My pregnant wife and I had a reservation for 8pm. We arrived at 7:58 (and very hungry). There was 1 empty table but the server (that did not catch his name, but he was short, wore glasses and bald) said that we could not take it because it was for 4 people and we were 2 and that our table was still occupied but the guests were supposed to be leaving soon, then he made us wait outside. After 13 minutes I went inside and asked him if he could at least get us water and their courtesy bread basket since my wife was very hungry. He said sure, but he never did. 10 minutes later after were were about to leave he came outside and said that the guests from our table were still there and that he was going to sit us in the same table (the 4 seater that I asked since the beginning and that has been empty all the time). We sat and ordered right away the drinks. Then 20 minutes passed by and I reminded him of the drinks and that we where waiting for him to order. He wrote our order and said that he will be with the drinks shortly. Another 20 minutes passed by and no drinks, then I see him getting drinks to another couple that arrived later than us. By that time were so upset that we stand up and I asked him if we owe him anything for the bread (the only thing he brought to the table whiting that hour) he answered no, then we left and he did not apologized and sincerely did not care. We spend 1+hour (with reservation) and we did not received anything. Then we visited the Mexican restaurant right next to it (that was full to capacity with only a 4 seater table available and 2 servers and they sat us without any issue) and within 30 minutes we ordered, ate and were ready to leave. As for us Buleria was our first and definitely last, I will not recommend to anyone.
